summary: This video aims to educate viewers on how to use the Search Console Sitemaps report effectively.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing an orange t-shirt, seated at a wooden table in a well-organized room. He is surrounded by various objects, including a laptop adorned with stickers, a gray mug, and colorful toy figures resembling LEGO characters. The background showcases shelves filled with books, decorative items, and framed pictures, creating a cozy and intellectual atmosphere. The man appears to be engaged in a conversation or presentation, as indicated by his hand gestures and facial expressions. Text appears on the screen, identifying him as "Daniel Waisberg, Search Advocate, Google." The video transitions to a white background with a blue vertical line and the text "Sitemaps in Search Console," suggesting a shift to a topic related to website optimization and search engine indexing. The overall setting and visual elements convey a professional yet approachable environment, likely aimed at educating viewers on search engine optimization techniques.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip opens with a male speaker, introducing himself and stating he is a search advocate at Google. He indicates he will discuss using the search console sitemaps report. He details the goals of the video, including understanding what a sitemap is, and whether you need one or not. Upbeat electronic music then plays.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing an orange t-shirt is seated at a wooden table in a room with a gray wall and shelves filled with various items, including books, a basket, and decorative objects. He is positioned in front of a laptop adorned with stickers, and there are LEGO figures and a gray mug on the table. The man appears to be speaking, as his hands are clasped together in front of him. Throughout the video, text overlays appear on the screen, providing information about different URL extensions and their purposes. The text includes phrases such as "images - URL extension," "videos - URL extension," "language/country versions - hreflang annotations," and "recent updates (news sites) - sitemap variation." These overlays suggest that the man is discussing various aspects of web development or SEO. The setting remains consistent, with the man maintaining a similar posture and the background unchanged, creating a focused and informative atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a single male speaker, who describes a sitemap as a signal about URLs for Google to crawl and mentions the information it may provide, such as URLs that were created or modified recently. The speaker outlines Google's support for providing additional information through extending URLs with images, videos, alternate languages, and country versions, and through special sitemaps for new sites. The speaker notes that this information may not be highlighted on the search console but can still be provided in the sitemap. Finally, the clip abruptly cuts to a distinct plop sound.

events_list.video_caption: The video features two men working at their respective desks in different settings. The first man, wearing a blue shirt, is seated at a wooden desk with a laptop, a blue notebook, a white mug, and some stationery items. The background includes a brick wall, framed pictures, and a lamp, creating a cozy and organized workspace. The second man, dressed in an orange shirt, is at a desk with a laptop adorned with stickers, a gray mug, and some toy figures. The background includes shelves with books, a framed picture of a wrench, and a curtain, giving a more casual and playful atmosphere. Both men appear to be engaged in work or discussion, with the man in the orange shirt gesturing with his hands, indicating active communication. The video captures the essence of a productive and focused work environment, highlighting the individuality of each workspace through their distinct settings and personal items.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker asking if Google will find all pages without a site map. A second male speaker replies in a friendly tone, stating that if the website is small and properly linked, "Google Bot can discover your content." Therefore, a site map may not be necessary.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing an orange t-shirt is seated at a wooden table in a well-organized room, with a laptop adorned with stickers and a gray mug in front of him. The background features shelves with books, decorative items, and framed pictures, creating a cozy and intellectual atmosphere. The man appears to be speaking, as indicated by his hand gestures and facial expressions. A text box appears on the screen, listing scenarios where a sitemap might be particularly useful: "your site is really large," "your pages are isolated," and "your site is new / changes quickly." The text is presented in a clear, white font against a gray background, enhancing readability. The man continues to speak, likely elaborating on the importance of sitemaps in these situations. The overall setting remains consistent, with the man maintaining a focused and engaged demeanor throughout the video.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip consists of a single male speaker discussing website optimization. He states that a sitemap can help Google decide "what and when to crawl your website". He continues by giving examples of situations where a sitemap is helpful, such as when a website is very large, or if pages are isolated. The speaker's tone is informative and professional.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing an orange t-shirt is seated at a wooden table in a well-organized room. He has a laptop with stickers on it, a gray mug, and several small orange and yellow figurines in front of him. The background features shelves with neatly arranged items, including books, a basket, and a small robot toy. A framed picture of a wrench hangs on the wall, and a gray curtain is partially visible. The man appears to be engaged in a conversation or presentation, as he gestures with his hands and occasionally looks directly at the camera. The atmosphere is casual and creative, with a focus on the man and the objects on the table.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with an informative male voice cautioning that using a sitemap doesn't guarantee that all pages will be crawled and indexed. He adds that in most cases, it will benefit the site, and there's no disadvantage in having one. He further clarifies that sitemaps don't replace normal crawling, and not including URLs won't stop them from being crawled. The voice then trails off, followed by the distinct sound of liquid pouring, likely into a glass. This concludes the audio clip.

events_list.video_caption: The video features two men sitting at separate desks, each engaged in a conversation or presentation. The first man, wearing a blue shirt, is seated at a desk with a laptop, a notebook, and a cup of coffee. He appears to be in a home office setting, with a brick wall and framed pictures in the background. The second man, dressed in an orange shirt, is at a different desk with a laptop adorned with stickers, a mug, and some toy figures. His background includes shelves with books and decorative items, and a framed picture of a wrench. Both men are gesturing with their hands, indicating they are actively speaking or explaining something. The video maintains a consistent setting and atmosphere, focusing on the men's interactions and the objects around them.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with one male speaker expressing interest and posing a question about site map creation. A second male speaker answers the question in an informative tone, explaining how to automatically generate site map files using website systems like WordPress plugins and the importance of automation versus manual creation. He acknowledges the possibility of requiring developer assistance, mentions limitations on URL numbers and file sizes, and advises using multiple site map files, potentially organized with an index file. Finally, the second speaker suggests visiting their website for more site map information.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing an orange t-shirt is seated at a wooden table, with his hands clasped together in front of him. The table is adorned with a gray mug, a laptop decorated with stickers, and a collection of small orange and yellow figurines. The background features a gray wall with shelves holding various items, including books, a basket, and a small robot figure. A framed picture of a wrench hangs on the wall, and a gray curtain is visible to the right. The man appears to be engaged in a conversation or presentation, as his facial expressions and hand gestures change slightly throughout the video. The setting is well-lit, creating a cozy and organized atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker starts by mentioning "search console." He provides a caveat that the sitemaps report shows only sitemaps submitted via search console, not those discovered through other methods, but that submitting sitemaps this way can still help track errors. He then announces that he will look at the report.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man sitting at a wooden desk in a room with a modern, organized aesthetic. He is wearing an orange t-shirt and has a beard. The desk is adorned with various items, including a laptop with stickers, a mug, and several small toy figures resembling LEGO characters. Behind him, shelves hold books, decorative items, and a framed picture of a wrench. The man appears to be speaking, with his hands clasped together on the desk. The scene transitions to a close-up of a computer screen displaying the Google Search Console interface, specifically the "Sitemaps" section. The interface shows options to add a new sitemap and a list of submitted sitemaps, with details such as the type, submission date, last modified date, status, and number of URLs. The video maintains focus on the Google Search Console interface, highlighting the functionality and details available for managing sitemaps.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip opens with a male speaker who is providing an instructional overview, mentioning phrases like "open search console" and "site maps report," and discussing how to find information about submitted site maps. His tone is informative and clear. He lists several data points from the report, including the sitemap URL, type, submission date, crawl status, and the number of URLs discovered. The speaker then ends his discussion abruptly.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases the Google Search Console interface, focusing on the 'Sitemaps' and 'Coverage' sections. Initially, the 'Sitemaps' section is displayed, where a user can add a new sitemap URL and view submitted sitemaps, including details like type, submission date, last modified date, status, and number of URLs. The interface features a sidebar with various options such as 'Preferences,' 'Enhancements,' and 'Security & Manual Actions.' The scene then transitions to the 'Coverage' section, highlighting metrics like indexed pages, valid pages, errors, and impressions, along with a graph illustrating the indexed pages over time. The 'Details' section below provides insights into the types of errors and their impact on the site's performance. The video then returns to the 'Sitemaps' section, emphasizing the submitted sitemap details and the user's ability to manage sitemap submissions. Throughout the video, the interface remains consistent, with a clean, professional design and a focus on providing actionable insights for website management.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single male speaker who describes the functionality of sitemaps, mentioning that "clicking it will lead you to the index coverage status report." He speaks in a factual and informative tone, mentioning that he'll discuss the report in the next episode. He continues, adding that sitemaps can be partially read even with errors.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a user navigating through the Google Search Console interface, specifically focusing on the 'Sitemaps' section. Initially, the user is seen adding a new sitemap URL, which is then submitted and listed under 'Submitted sitemaps.' The interface displays details such as the sitemap's type, submission date, last update, status, and estimated crawl rate. The user then navigates to a specific sitemap URL, revealing a 'General HTTP error' with a red warning icon, indicating that the sitemap could not be read. The error message suggests verifying the sitemap's accessibility and compliance with Google's guidelines. The video highlights the user's interaction with the console, including the submission of a sitemap and the subsequent error encountered, providing a clear view of the interface's layout and functionality.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a single male speaker offering a simple "good job" after stating that if your sitemap status is success. The speaker then transitions to discussing errors in the status column, advising listeners to click the specific row to see details and consult the search console help center for a list of errors.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a person wearing an orange shirt sitting at a desk, surrounded by various objects such as a laptop with stickers, a mug, and some toys. The background features shelves with books, decorative items, and framed pictures. The scene transitions to a Google Search Console interface, displaying the 'Sitemaps' section where a new sitemap is added and submitted. The interface shows details of submitted sitemaps, including their type, submission date, last update, status, and the number of URLs. The video then returns to the person in the orange shirt, who appears to be explaining or discussing something, as indicated by their hand gestures and facial expressions. The video maintains a consistent setting throughout, with the person continuing to speak and gesture, providing a coherent narrative that connects the technical aspects of sitemap management with a personal explanation or tutorial.
events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker explains how to submit and delete sitemaps in a measured, informative tone. He provides instructions such as how to open the "Sitemaps report" and submit a URL and recommends how to remove URLs from the Google index. He transitions to describing how to use sitemaps and how Search Console can help.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing an orange t-shirt is seated at a wooden table, surrounded by various objects including a laptop adorned with stickers, a gray mug, and several colorful toy figures resembling LEGO characters. The background features shelves with books, a framed picture of a wrench, and a gray curtain. The man appears to be speaking, as indicated by his hand gestures and facial expressions. A blue banner with the text "Subscribe YouTube.com/GoogleWebmasters" appears at the bottom of the screen, suggesting a call to action for viewers to subscribe to the channel. The scene transitions to a white background with a grid pattern and a gray rectangle, possibly indicating a shift in the video's content or a visual effect. The man then interacts with a globe, placing an orange toy figure on top of it, while other toy figures are positioned around the globe. The video maintains a consistent setting and atmosphere, with the man engaging with the objects on the table and the background elements remaining unchanged.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with someone talking about the next episode, which will address "how to use search console" to check indexed pages and problems. He then promotes the Google Webmaster series, with a guest answering questions from the community, and encourages subscription to the Google Webmaster's YouTube channel, promising search console videos. A brief musical interlude of upbeat, electronic dance music with a positive and energetic mood follows. A second speaker is then heard, questioning "Junior, what are you doing there?", referring to something as "not a sitemap". This is followed by a burst of laughter.
